name: Nebraska National Guard Tuition Assistance Program (NGTAP)
description: Pays 75% of tuition at resident rate for Nebraska National Guard members attending any Nebraska accredited institution (public or private/not-for-profit). Private school tuition capped at UNL rate. Must exhaust federal TA first. Enlisted members only, to bachelor's level only. Use within first 10 years of Guard membership. 3-year service obligation after completion. Cap: 1,200 members per fiscal year.
eligibility: Nebraska National Guard enlisted member (officers NOT eligible except prior enlisted)
Complete Basic Training and MOS training
Use within 10 years of joining Guard
how_to_apply: Apply through Nebraska National Guard Education Office

name: Active Reserve Tuition Credit (50%)
description: Enlisted members of Nebraska-based Active Reserve units receive 50% tuition credit at University of Nebraska campuses, Nebraska state colleges, and Nebraska community colleges. Limited to 200 new applicants per calendar year. Must have 2+ years remaining on enlistment at start of term.
eligibility: Enlisted member Nebraska-based Active Reserve unit
how_to_apply: Apply through institution's financial aid office

name: Waiver of Tuition for Children/Spouses of Deceased Veterans
description: Children and spouses of veterans who died of service-connected illness or injury receive 100% waiver of tuition and tuition-related fees (excludes lab fees, athletic tickets, student union). Valid for ONE community college degree/diploma/certificate AND ONE baccalaureate degree from university or state college. Must be Nebraska resident eligible for in-state tuition.
eligibility: Child (biological, adopted, or step) OR spouse/surviving spouse
Veteran parent/spouse died from service-connected illness or injury
VA disability rating decision date BEFORE start of term
Nebraska resident eligible for in-state tuition
benefit_amount: 100% tuition + tuition fees waiver (1 community college + 1 bachelor's)
how_to_apply: Apply through Nebraska Department of Veterans' Affairs BEFORE term start

name: In-State Tuition for Veterans and Dependents
description: Veterans, service members, and their dependents eligible for in-state tuition rates at Nebraska public institutions regardless of state residency under Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act.
eligibility: Veteran using GI Bill OR dependent using transferred benefits
how_to_apply: Submit eligibility documentation to Nebraska institution

name: Homestead Exemption (100% Service-Connected Disability)
description: Veterans with 100% service-connected disability receive 100% property tax exemption on homestead and 1 acre of land regardless of home value or income. Must own and occupy property January 1 through August 15 of tax year. Apply every 5 years (years ending in 0 or 5: 2025, 2030, etc.).
eligibility: Own and occupy homestead January 1 through August 15
benefit_amount: 100% property tax exemption (no value or income limit)
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor February 2-June 30 (every 5 years)

name: Homestead Exemption (50%+ Service-Connected Disability)
description: NEW 2024! Veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability receive property tax exemption based on sliding scale income limits. Minimum payment $1,200/year. Household assets must be ≤$1 million in prior 3 years. Must be receiving Social Security or retirement benefits.
eligibility: Own and occupy homestead January 1 through August 15
benefit_amount: Partial exemption (minimum $1,200/year payment, based on income)
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor February 2-June 30 annually

name: Homestead Exemption (Wartime Veteran Totally Disabled Non-Service)
description: Wartime veterans totally disabled by non-service-connected illness or accident receive partial property tax exemption based on income limits. Must have served during WWII (12/7/41-12/31/46), Korean War (6/25/50-1/31/55), or Vietnam War (2/28/61-5/7/75 in Vietnam). Income limits on sliding scale.
eligibility: Served during WWII, Korea, or Vietnam
Own and occupy homestead January 1 through August 15
benefit_amount: Partial exemption based on income (sliding scale)
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor February 2-June 30 annually

name: Homestead Exemption (Paraplegic/Multiple Amputee VA Home)
description: Veterans who are paraplegic or have multiple amputations whose home was substantially contributed to by VA receive 100% property tax exemption regardless of home value or income. Also available to unremarried surviving spouse (or remarried after age 57).
eligibility: OR unremarried surviving spouse (or remarried after 57)
benefit_amount: 100% property tax exemption (no value or income limit)
how_to_apply: Apply with County Assessor February 2-June 30

name: Disabled Veteran Motor Vehicle Tax Exemption (NEW 2026)
description: Starting January 1, 2026: ALL disabled and/or blind veterans receive exemption from Motor Vehicle Tax AND Motor Vehicle Fee for ONE vehicle owned and used for personal transportation. Exemption does NOT cover plate fees, sales tax, or wheel tax. Previously only for lost use/amputation of 2+ limbs or blindness.
eligibility: ANY VA disability rating OR blind
Vehicle owned and used for personal transportation
benefit_amount: Exemption from motor vehicle tax + motor vehicle fee (1 vehicle)
how_to_apply: Apply with County Treasurer in county of residence

name: Military Pay Income Tax (TAXED)
description: Nebraska IS one of few states that TAXES active duty military pay for residents. Military pay earned by Nebraska residents IS subject to state income tax.
how_to_apply: Include on Nebraska income tax return

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Options (Choose Once)
description: Veterans must choose retirement pay tax treatment within 2 years of separation (CANNOT change later). OPTION 1: Exclude 40% of retirement pay for 7 consecutive years starting election year. OPTION 2: Exclude 15% of retirement pay starting at age 67 for life.
eligibility: Must elect within 2 years of separation
benefit_amount: 40% exempt for 7 years OR 15% exempt age 67+ (choose once)
how_to_apply: Elect on Nebraska income tax return within 2 years

name: Survivor Benefit Plans Tax Exemption
description: SBP (Survivor Benefit Plan), RCSBP (Reserve Component SBP), and RSFPP (Retired Serviceman's Family Protection Plan) annuities are 100% exempt from Nebraska state income tax.
eligibility: Receiving SBP, RCSBP, or RSFPP payments
how_to_apply: Exclude from Nebraska income tax return

name: Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) Retirement Tax Exemption
description: TSP distributions after retirement are NOT subject to Nebraska state taxes. Early distributions may incur higher federal taxes. TSP does not withhold for state/local taxes.
benefit_amount: TSP retirement distributions exempt (early may have penalties)
how_to_apply: Exclude retirement TSP distributions from Nebraska tax return

name: Veterans Employment Preference (5% or 10%)
description: Honorably discharged veterans with passing exam scores receive 5% added to final score on state/county/municipal employment exams. Disabled veterans OR Purple Heart recipients receive ADDITIONAL 5% (total 10%). Preference also available to: spouses of active duty (during + 180 days after separation), spouses of 100% disabled veterans.
eligibility: Nebraska resident veteran with passing exam score (5%)
OR disabled veteran/Purple Heart (+5 more = 10% total)
benefit_amount: 5% or 10% added to employment exam scores
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state/county/municipal job applications with DD-214

name: Military Experience for Occupational Licensing
description: Veterans and active duty members may receive occupational licenses based on military experience and training. Eligible for expedited and temporary license approvals. Spouse portability also available.
eligibility: Nebraska veteran or active duty member
how_to_apply: Contact relevant Nebraska licensing board with military credentials

name: FREE Lifetime Hunting/Fishing/Fur Harvest (50%+ Disabled)
description: Nebraska resident veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability OR receiving VA pension for 100% non-service-connected disability receive FREE lifetime combo fishing/fur-harvesting/hunting permit + habitat stamp + aquatic habitat stamp + migratory waterfowl stamp. Must renew annually for $5 after initial free permit.
benefit_amount: FREE lifetime hunt/fish/fur permit + all stamps ($5 annual renewal)
how_to_apply: Apply through VA office (3800 Village Drive, Lincoln) or Nebraska Game and Parks

name: $5 Veteran Hunting/Fishing/Fur Harvest (Age 64+)
description: Nebraska resident veterans age 64+ receive Annual Small Game Hunt/Fish/Fur Harvest Permit for only $5 (includes all state stamps). Must have served on active duty beyond basic training. Annual renewal for $5.
eligibility: Served on active duty beyond basic training
how_to_apply: Apply at Nebraska Game and Parks office/service center with DD-214

name: $5 Deployed Military Hunt/Fish Permit (One-Time)
description: Nebraska residents deployed out of state within last 12 months receive one-time Annual Small Game Hunt/Fish/Fur Harvest Permit for $5 (includes all stamps) upon return.
eligibility: Deployed out of state within last 12 months
how_to_apply: Apply at Game and Parks office with deployment papers

name: FREE Veterans Day Hunting Permits
description: Honorably discharged Nebraska resident veterans receive FREE one-day hunt permit + habitat stamp + Nebraska Migratory Waterfowl Stamp to hunt on Veterans Day (November 11) annually. Federal Duck Stamp and HIP registration still required for waterfowl.
benefit_amount: FREE one-day hunt permit + stamps (Veterans Day)
how_to_apply: Purchase online or at Game and Parks office

name: Veteran Bonus Waterfowl Weekend
description: Special annual waterfowl hunting weekend for qualifying resident and nonresident veterans. Must have veteran status in Nebraska Game and Parks Permit System OR veteran designation on state driver's license.
eligibility: Veteran status in permit system OR state DL designation
how_to_apply: Register in Nebraska Game and Parks Permit System

name: Active Duty Resident Hunting/Fishing Rates
description: Nonresident active duty service members stationed in Nebraska for 30+ days may purchase hunting and fishing permits at RESIDENT prices.
how_to_apply: Present military ID at Game and Parks office

name: $5 Active Duty State Parks Annual Pass
description: Active duty service members stationed in Nebraska receive annual vehicle park entry permit to 76+ Nebraska State Parks for $5 (valid January 1-December 31).
how_to_apply: Purchase at Nebraska State Parks with military ID

name: FREE Lifetime State Parks Pass (Disabled Veterans)
description: Nebraska resident disabled veterans (50%+ service-connected OR 100% non-service pension) receive FREE Disabled Veteran's Lifetime Park Entry Permit. Authorizes free entry to all Nebraska State Parks. Lost/stolen permits not replaceable.
how_to_apply: Apply through VA office (3800 Village Drive, Lincoln) or permit section

name: Vets Get Pets Adoption Fee Assistance
description: Nebraska Department of Veterans' Affairs program covers up to $350 maximum of eligible veteran's pet adoption fees. Funding dependent on Vets Get Pets license plate sales.
benefit_amount: Up to $350 pet adoption fee coverage
how_to_apply: Contact Nebraska Department of Veterans' Affairs

name: Special Veteran License Plates
description: Multiple veteran license plate options: Disabled American Veteran plates (100% disabled), Military Honor plates (all branches), general veteran plates. Some FREE, others standard fee. Disabled American Veteran plates DO NOT equal motor vehicle tax exemption (separate applications).
benefit_amount: FREE or standard fee specialty plates
how_to_apply: First register with Nebraska Veterans' Registry, then apply at County Treasurer DMV

name: Veteran Designation on Driver's License/ID
description: Nebraska veterans can request 'veteran' designation on driver's license and state ID card for no additional fee at renewal OR standard replacement fee anytime. Must first register with Nebraska Department of Veterans' Affairs Military and Veterans' Registry.
benefit_amount: Veteran designation on DL/ID (no fee at renewal)
how_to_apply: Register with NDVA first (402-471-2458), then request at DMV

name: Nebraska Veterans Homes (4 Locations)
description: Four state veterans homes in Scottsbluff, Grand Island, Bellevue, and Norfolk. Provide various therapies, memory care, and hospice services. Eligible dependents include spouses, unremarried surviving spouses, and Gold Star parents. Fees based on ability to pay ($0 to $4,000+/month).
eligibility: Fees based on ability to pay
how_to_apply: Apply directly to home, through VSO, or recognized veterans service organization

name: Nebraska Veterans Cemetery (Alliance)
description: State veterans cemetery in Alliance. Follows same eligibility as federal VA cemeteries but may have residency requirements. Burial at no cost to families for eligible veterans and dependents.
how_to_apply: Contact Nebraska Veterans Cemetery in Alliance

name: University of Nebraska Law School Civil Clinic
description: Free legal services offered to Nebraska veterans through UNL College of Law Civil Clinic.
how_to_apply: Contact University of Nebraska College of Law Civil Clinic
source_name: University of Nebraska College of Law
